## Privacy-first defaults

The package defaults to privacy-safe outputs. On load, it sets:

```r
getOption("zoomstudentengagement.privacy_level")
```

to `"mask"` unless you have set it otherwise. This ensures personally
identifying fields such as `preferred_name`, `name`, and `student_id` are
masked to generic labels like `Student 01`.

## Changing behavior (not recommended)

You can opt out, but this will emit a warning and is not recommended for
student data:

```r
library(zoomstudentengagement)
set_privacy_defaults("none")
# ... your analysis ...
set_privacy_defaults("mask")  # restore default
```

## Example

```r
library(zoomstudentengagement)
df <- tibble::tibble(
  section = c("A", "A"),
  preferred_name = c("Alice", "Bob"),
  session_ct = c(3, 5)
)
df_masked <- ensure_privacy(df)
df_masked
```

## Ethical use

- Use this package to support participation equity, not surveillance.
- Avoid publishing identifiable student data without consent.
- Review institutional FERPA guidance and your IRB requirements.
